comment.shortText: Deletes the specified file from the app's data store.
comment.returns: Resolves when the file has been removed or rejects with an error.

comment.text: The path to the file to delete.

Set to true if the file was originally signed
in order for the corresponding signature file to also be deleted.

comment.shortText: Get the app storage bucket URL
comment.returns:
That resolves to the URL of the app index file
or rejects if it fails

comment.text: the app private key used to generate the app address

comment.shortText: Retrieves the specified file from the app's data store.
comment.returns:
that resolves to the raw data in the file
or rejects with an error

comment.text: the path to the file to read

comment.shortText: Get the URL for reading a file from an app's data store.
comment.returns: that resolves to the URL or rejects with an error

comment.text: the path to the file to read

comment.shortText: Fetch the public read URL of a user file for the specified app.
comment.returns:
that resolves to the public read URL of the file
or rejects with an error

comment.text: the path to the file to read
The Blockstack ID of the user to look up

comment.shortText: List the set of files in this application's Gaia storage bucket.
comment.returns: that resolves to the number of files listed

comment.text:
a callback to invoke on each named file that
returns `true` to continue the listing operation or `false` to end it.
If the call is ended early by the callback, the last file is excluded.
If an error occurs the entire call is rejected.

comment.shortText: Stores the data provided in the app's data store to to the file specified.
comment.returns:
that resolves if the operation succeed and rejects
if it failed

comment.text: the path to store the data in
the data to store in the file

comment.shortText: The configuration for the user's Gaia storage provider.
Used to pass options to [[UserSession.getFile]]
The app to lookup for multi-player storage - defaults to current origin.

tags.text:
`window.location.origin`
Only if available in the executing environment, otherwise `undefined`.

comment.shortText:
Try to decrypt the data with the app private key.
If a string is specified, it is used as the private key.

The Blockstack ID to lookup for multi-player storage.
If not specified, the currently signed in username is used.

Whether the content should be verified, only to be used
when [[UserSession.putFile]] was set to `sign = true`.

The URL to use for zonefile lookup. If falsey, this will use
the blockstack.js's [[getNameInfo]] function instead.
The app to lookup for multi-player storage - defaults to current origin.

tags.text:
`window.location.origin`
Only if available in the executing environment, otherwise `undefined`.

comment.shortText:
The Blockstack ID to lookup for multi-player storage.
If not specified, the currently signed in username is used.

The URL to use for zonefile lookup. If falsey, this will use
the blockstack.js's [[getNameInfo]] function instead.
Specify a valid MIME type, encryption options, and whether to sign the [[UserSession.putFile]].

Specifies the Content-Type header for unencrypted data.
If the `encrypt` is enabled, this option is ignored, and the
Content-Type header is set to `application/json` for the ciphertext
JSON envelope.

Encrypt the data with the app public key.
If a string is specified, it is used as the public key.
If the boolean `true` is specified then the current user's app public key is used.
Options for constructing a Storage instance

The userSession object to construct the Storage instance with.
The session object contains the credentials and keys for
Gaia hub access and encryption.
Retrieves the specified file from the app's data store.

tags.text: the path to the file to read

that resolves to the raw data in the file
or rejects with an error

comment.shortText:
Returns a BlockstackError correlating to the given HTTP response,
with the provided errorMsg. Throws if the HTTP response is 'ok'.

Determines if a gaia error response is possible to recover from
by refreshing the gaiaHubConfig, and retrying the request.
